intro: Jatropha octandra, commonly known as the African crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters tall, characterized by its spiny stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellow flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing toxic seeds. Jatropha octandra is part of the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its latex-producing species. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
